sentences.en: "Count Dracula, I presume," I said wittily.
sentences.cn: “我想是德拉库拉伯爵吧。”我打趣地说。

sentences.en: "Had he been home all week?"— 'I presume so.'
sentences.cn: “他整个星期都在家吗？”——“我想是这样的。”

sentences.en: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.cn: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

sentences.en: Dido's told you the whole sad story, I presume?
sentences.cn: 我想狄多已经把这件伤心事全部告诉你了吧？

sentences.en: I presume I am up to this job.
I presume you're here on business.
sentences.cn: 我想你是来这里出差的。

sentences.en: I would not presume to censure Osborne for hating his mother.
sentences.cn: 我不会擅自批评奥斯本恨他妈妈这件事。

sentences.en: I wouldn't presume to question your judgment.
sentences.cn: 我不会冒昧地质疑你的判断。

sentences.en: Take care that you don't presume on my feelings.
sentences.cn: 注意不要滥用我的感情.

sentences.en: The legal definition of "know" often presumes mental control.
sentences.cn: “知情”的法律界定通常以思维控制力为前提。

sentences.en: They are very expensive, I presume?
They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.cn: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务非常愤慨。

sentences.en: We don't presume to reason Tom out of his foolish venture.
sentences.cn: 我们不说服汤姆避免愚蠢的冒险.

sentences.en: We mustn't presume too much upon the reliability of such sources.
sentences.cn: 我们不应过分指望这类消息来源的可靠性.

sentences.en: We should not presume too much on the reliability of such sources.
sentences.cn: 我们不该过分指望这种消息来源的可靠性.

sentences.en: You had better presume no such thing.

trans.tran_en: to accept something as being true and base something else on it

trans.tran_cn: 擅自行动，相信，敢于，放肆
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

trans.tran_cn: 以为，认为，假定，假设，推测，意味着
trans.tran_en: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain
